definition: sour/tart/sick at heart/grieved/sore/aching/pedantic/impractical/to make sarcastic remarks about sb/an acid

sentences.english: Sweet and sour pork is one of the classic foods in Cantonese cuisine.
sentences.chinese: 咕嚕肉是粵菜中的經典菜餚，以甜酸汁和豬肉煮成。

sentences.english: He had tasted their intimate community with every sauce.
sentences.chinese: 他嚐到了他們親密交往的各種甜酸苦辣。

sentences.english: Pickled ginger is at once sweet, tart, and salty. It is served with Japanese sushi.
sentences.chinese: 甜酸帶鹹的醃姜，是日本壽司的好搭配。

sentences.english: Could you give me some more napkins, some sweet-and-sour sauce and pepper?
sentences.chinese: 請多給我幾張紙巾和一些甜酸醬及胡椒。

sentences.english: He get tasted the sweets or bitters of life.
sentences.chinese: 他已嚐遍了一生的甜酸苦辣。

sentences.english: She has tasted the sweets and bitters of life.
sentences.chinese: 她已嚐遍了人生的甜酸苦辣。

sentences.english: He has tasted sweets and bitters of life.
sentences.chinese: 他以嚐遍了人生的甜酸苦辣。

sentences.english: Because it always had a kind of sweet and sour flavor cyan.
sentences.chinese: 因爲它總會有一股淡青色的甜酸氣息。

sentences.english: Sour, sweet, bitter, pungent , all must be tasted.
Life in this documentary, the collection of sweets and bitters of his own.
sentences.chinese: 在這部人生紀錄片裏，收藏着自己的甜酸苦辣。

sentences.english: I've experienced a fair bit about the thrills and spills of running a small business.
sentences.chinese: 我已經體會到了經營一個小公司的甜酸苦辣。

sentences.english: The effects of inoculated lactic acid bacteria on pickling process and quality of sweet and sour Allium chinense was discussed.
sentences.chinese: 探討了接種乳酸菌對甜酸藠頭醃製工藝和品質的影響。

sentences.english: Life, like a box of chocolates, is full of sweetness as well as bitterness.
sentences.chinese: 生活是一道甜酸苦辣混合的餐點。

sentences.english: he has tasted the sweets and bitters of life.
sentences.chinese: 他已經嚐遍了人的生活的甜酸苦辣。

sentences.english: Enjoy your "sweet' sour, bitter, spicy" in everyday, it's because this is LIFE…
sentences.chinese: 生活上的甜酸苦辣都值得珍惜，因爲這就是人生。

definition: to whet the appetite/appetizing/to amuse oneself at sb's expense/to tease

yuxiang, a seasoning of Chinese cuisine that typically contains garlic, scallions, ginger, sugar, salt, chili peppers etc (Although "yuxiang" literally means "fish fragrance", it contains no seafood.)
